349.article_body: Five members of a family were killed and four others were injured in a road accident in Karnataka's Koppal district on Saturday. They were returning from a birthday party, police said. "Prima facie, it looks like a lorry has hit the Scorpio vehicle leading to accident. We have found a spare part of other vehicle," Koppal SP Arunangshu Giri said.

350.title: We thought it could be done because of IPL experience: Axar on 64*(35) vs WI
350.article_body: India all-rounder Axar Patel said they knew they could chase down West Indies' 312-run target after being 212/5 in 40 overs due to their experience from IPL. "When I went out, I aimed for 10-11 an over. We thought it could be done because of IPL experience," he stated. Axar smashed three 4s and five 6s in his 64-run innings.

351.title: Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal get death threats, Mumbai Police begin probe
351.article_body: Actors Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal have received threats to their lives from an unidentified person on social media, reported ANI on Monday. Mumbai Police also informed that a case has been registered against the unidentified person and an investigation has been initiated. Mumbai Police added that the case has been registered at the Santacruz Police Station.

352.title: A person of extraordinary courage: Mahindra on President Droupadi Murmu
352.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Monday took to Twitter to praise India’s 15th President, Droupadi Murmu. Sharing a video, Mahindra wrote, "Look no further for your Monday Motivation Above all else, she is a person of extraordinary courage and a commitment to serve. Her inner strength has enabled her to withstand all the challenges life has thrown at her."

353.title: Moving car catches fire on Maha's Mira-Bhayandar Road, no casualties reported
353.article_body: A moving white sedan car reportedly caught fire on Mira-Bhayander Road near Mumbai. Reports said that the driver of the car and a woman who was inside the vehicle came out immediately after it caught fire. The incident took place near the Bhayander Golden Nest Circle. Reports added that no injuries or casualties were reported during the incident.

354.title: Youth Cong leader in Gujarat arrested for throwing ink on posters of CM, PM
354.article_body: A Youth Congress leader in Gujarat's Bharuch district was arrested for allegedly throwing ink on the posters of CM Bhupendra Patel and PM Narendra Modi. The accused, Nikhil Shah, was protesting at the Bharuch Collector's office against the Enforcement Directorate's questioning of Sonia Gandhi. Shah had "secretly brought an ink pen" and was arrested under IPC's section 505, police said.

355.title: Musk dropped to one knee, begged forgiveness from Brin over affair with wife: Report
355.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reportedly "dropped to one knee" in front of Google Co-founder Sergey Brin at a party while apologising and begging for forgiveness for an alleged affair with his wife, Nicole Shanahan. While Brin acknowledged the apology, he isn't speaking to Musk regularly, the report added. Meanwhile, Musk dismissed the report, calling the alleged affair "total bs".

356.title: Ranbir can portray finer nuances of every role effectively: Anil Kapoor
356.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor has said that his 'Animal' co-star Ranbir Kapoor is an actor who can portray the finer nuances of every role effectively. He also called Ranbir talented and hard-working. Speaking about 'Animal', Anil said, "I liked the story...Sandeep Reddy Vanga (director) narrated to me, and I was sure that I wanted to be part of the film."

357.title: Tobi Amusan breaks world record in 100m hurdles in semis, wins gold in final
357.article_body: Nigeria's Tobi Amusan broke the women's 100m hurdles world record in the semi-final and won the gold medal in the final at the World Athletics Championships. Amusan clocked 12.12 seconds in the semi-final, breaking the previous mark of 12.20 by 0.08 seconds. She won gold in 12.06 seconds, however, this wasn't recognised as a world record due to illegal tailwind.

358.title: Encourage use of bhang, cannabis as alternative to liquor to prevent crime: BJP MLA
358.article_body: Chhattisgarh BJP MLA Krishnamurti Bandhi suggested that use of bhang and cannabis should be encouraged as an alternative to liquor for addiction. He claimed that persons addicted to these substances hardly commit offences like rape, murder and dacoity. "Once I had discussed it in Assembly...Somewhere alcohol is the reason for rape, murder and quarrel...It's my personal opinion," he added.

359.title: Noida authority to remove more illegal buildings on floodplains
359.article_body: The Noida authority has issued warning notices to at least 500 house owners to remove illegal structures from Hindon floodplains or face demolition. The notices have been issued under a mega drive, aimed at freeing floodplains of the Hindon and Yamuna rivers. In June, the authority had demolished at least 100 farmhouses built on the Yamuna floodplains.

360.title: Koreans don't know a lot about our industry but they know SRK: Anushka Sen
360.article_body: Actress Anushka Sen, who recently travelled to South Korea for her debut Korean project, spoke about how the people there don't know a lot about Indian cinema. "I was telling them about...our culture, industry, films. They don't know a lot about it...But they know...Shah Rukh Khan," she added. Anushka further said South Korean people are "really hyped about Indian food".

361.title: I want to collaborate with Justin Bieber and Charlie Puth: Armaan Malik
361.article_body: Singer-songwriter Armaan Malik has said he wants to collaborate with Justin Bieber and Charlie Puth. "Justin Bieber and Charlie Puth are my favourite artistes," he added. "Charlie Puth is someone I really love. I love his musicality, the way he writes and produces...I feel like when we get together in the studio, some magic is bound to happen," said Armaan.

362.title: Arunachal logs 82 new COVID-19 cases, biggest one-day spike in July
362.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh on Sunday reported 82 new cases of COVID-19, taking the state's active case tally to 363, a senior official informed. This is the biggest single-day spike in fresh cases in July, the official added. The state's coronavirus death toll remained unchanged at 296 as no new COVID-19-related deaths were reported there in the past 24 hours.

363.title: My election is proof the poor in India can dream & make it come true: President Murmu
363.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu in her first address said, "My election is proof that the poor in India can dream and also make their dreams come true." She added, "I started my journey from a small tribal village in Odisha...it was like a dream for me to get elementary education...I became the first daughter of my village to go to college."

364.title: Zomato investors lose ₹89,000 crore in 7 months as stock falls to record low
364.article_body: About ₹89,000 crore has been wiped out of Zomato investors' wealth in seven months as the food delivery company's stock fell to a record low on Monday. Shares of Zomato declined over 13% to ₹46 on the NSE in early trade. The company's market value declined to ₹36,848 crore, from a peak of over ₹1.25 lakh crore in November 2021.

365.title: Axar smashes most sixes by an Indian batting at no. 7 in a successful ODI run chase
365.article_body: India all-rounder Axar Patel set the record for smashing most sixes batting at number seven or lower by an Indian in a successful ODI run chase. The 28-year-old smashed five sixes as India chased down a 312-run target in the second ODI against West Indies. The previous record was jointly held by MS Dhoni and Yusuf Pathan (three sixes each).

366.title: Mumbai's drinking water fountains to come back, heritage circuit to be made
366.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has decided to restore 18 drinking water fountains called 'pyaus' and create heritage tourist circuit of these structures. Reports said some 'pyaus' were constructed with troughs for horses and cattle. Reports quoted experts as saying that 80-100 'pyaus' may have disappeared over the years. Some have been traced with help of history, photographs and films.

367.title: Design of supersonic jet that can fly from New York to London in 3.5 hours unveiled
367.article_body: US-based Boom Supersonic recently unveiled the latest design for a supersonic jet that can potentially fly from New York to London in 3.5 hours. Dubbed 'Overture', the jet is said to be the world's fastest airliner. The jet can fly at the speeds of 2,100 kmph over water with a range of 4,250 nautical miles and can carry 65-80 passengers.

368.title: Hope to score a century in next game: Shreyas Iyer on 2 consecutive fifties
368.article_body: After his two consecutive half-centuries in the ongoing ODI series against West Indies, Team India batter Shreyas Iyer has said he's hopeful of scoring a century in the third and final ODI. "You don't get such kind of starts every time in international cricket," he added. Iyer scored 54(57) in the first ODI and 63(71) in the second.

369.title: 144 blood bags found in Patna fridge, 2 held for running illegal blood bank
369.article_body: Two people were arrested for running an unauthorised blood bank after 144 polybags filled with blood were found in a small fridge used to store vegetables in Patna. Polybags did not have date of collection or group of blood. Police said the accused used to collect blood from the smackers and sold it to different hospitals for ₹3,000 per bag.

370.title: 400 chickens die as tempo overturns on Mumbai-Nashik highway
370.article_body: At least 400 chickens died on Mumbai-Nashik highway after the tempo transporting them overturned, a police official said. "The incident took place at Padgha toll naka when the tempo driver tried to avoid a truck that was overtaking it," he said. The chickens were supposed to be delivered to a shop in Thane's Wagle Estate, he added.

371.title: Democracy without independent judiciary is hollow: Gauhati HC judge
371.article_body: Gauhati High Court Justice N Kotiswar Singh on Sunday said that democracy without an independent judiciary is hollow. "Judiciary is one of the important limbs of democracy," Justice Singh added. He addressed an event to lay the foundation stone of a court-cum-office building of the Gauhati bench of the Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT).

372.title: What is the rate at which employees are leaving India's top IT companies?
372.article_body: Infosys has reported the highest rate at which employees are leaving the company among its Indian peers for April-June quarter, at 28.4%. The IT major is followed by HCL Tech with 23.8% employee attrition rate, Wipro at 23.3% and TCS at 19.7%. Meanwhile, Infosys added the most number of employees during the quarter, followed by Wipro, TCS and HCL Tech.

373.title: Never thought I’d do more than a movie: Shruti Haasan on completing 13 yrs
373.article_body: Shruti Haasan took to Instagram after she completed 13 years in the film industry. "I never...thought I'd do more than a movie, even [though] I wasn't born to do this, I learned to love it," her caption read. "Cinema has become the greatest source of joy in my life...it has given me the life I'm so grateful for," she added.

374.title: Droupadi Murmu takes oath as the 15th President of India
374.article_body: President-elect Droupadi Murmu took oath as the 15th President of India on Monday. Chief Justice of India NV Ramana administered the oath to her in the central hall of the Parliament . She scripted history on Thursday after defeating Opposition Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha to become the first tribal and the second woman to hold the top constitutional post.

375.title: Zomato share price falls by 13% to hit all-time low of ₹46
375.article_body: Zomato's share price declined by 13% on Monday to hit an all-time low of ₹46 during early trade as the one-year lock-in for promoters, shareholders, employees and others ended today. The stock had last closed at ₹53.65 on Friday. Zomato was listed on the markets on July 23, 2021, and hit its lifetime high of ₹169 apiece in November 2021.

376.title: Telangana resident shows Monkeypox symptoms, samples sent to Pune
376.article_body: A 40-year-old man, who returned from Kuwait to Telangana's Kamareddy on July 6, has shown symptoms of monkeypox, state health officials said. The patient has been shifted to Government Fever Hospital and his samples have been sent to Pune's NIV lab. Health officials have identified six people who were in contact with the person and have kept them in isolation.

377.title: Folding Ganpati rath planned for 1st time to avoid clash with Pune Metro line
377.article_body: To avoid clash with Pune Metro line above Lakdi Pul bridge, Tulshibaug Ganpati mandal has decided to make a folding rath for the procession for the first time. "Total height of the overhead Metro is 21 feet...height of our Ganpati statue itself is 18 feet and the entire rath height goes up to 25 to 30 feet," mandal secretary said.

378.title: People of PoK look to India questioning when will they get freedom: RSS leader
378.article_body: RSS leader Dattatreya Hosabale said that the people of Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir look towards India questioning when will they get freedom. "Since 1947, Pakistan has made every attempt to propagate terrorism, separatism and war in J&K," he added. "People of Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir are the first victims. They should get complete justice. They are longing today," he stated.

379.title: India reports 16,866 new COVID-19 cases; list of states with most active cases released
379.article_body: India has reported 16,866 COVID-19 cases, 18,148 recoveries and 41 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 20,279 cases and 36 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases stood at 1,50,877, while the death toll reached 5,26,074.

380.title: My biggest cheerleader always: Kunal Kemmu mourns grandmother's demise
380.article_body: Kunal Kemmu took to Instagram on Sunday to share the news of his maternal grandmother's demise. He also shared a picture featuring him, his daughter Inaaya and his 'naani'. Along with the picture, Kunal wrote, "I have such special and amazing memories of her telling me stories, feeding me...and always telling me to believe in myself. My biggest cheerleader always."

381.title: Ranbir Kapoor, Imtiaz Ali told me to never leave acting: Sanjana Sanghi
381.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi, who made her film debut in Imtiaz Ali's directorial 'Rockstar', has said that Ranbir Kapoor used to hold her hand through the film's sets. "That's what made me fall in love with filmmaking. Ranbir and Imtiaz told me...I should never leave acting...pushed me further...told my mother about it," she added. Sanjana played Nargis Fakhri's sister in 'Rockstar'.

382.title: We lost the game in the last 6 overs: Nicholas Pooran after defeat vs India
382.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said they lost the second ODI against India in the last six overs of the game. "[In] the last couple of overs, we didn't hold our nerves...We just needed one wicket to seal the game but Axar played really well," stated Pooran. Axar Patel smashed unbeaten 64 runs off 35 balls to help India win.

383.title: Chitra told ED that staff's phones were tapped to check information leak: Officials
383.article_body: Former NSE MD Chitra Ramkrishna has told the Enforcement Directorate that monitoring of phones at the bourses was done to ensure there was no leak of critical data such as passwords and other reports to the competitors, said officials. Meanwhile, ED said her act was clear "illegal interception" as employees were not aware that their calls were put under surveillance.

384.title: Miss you Manny: Sanjana remembers Sushant on 2 yrs of Dil Bechara
384.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi took to Instagram on Sunday to share a post marking two years since the release of her film 'Dil Bechara'. In her note, she said that she missed Manny, the character played by late actor Sushant Singh Rajput in the film. "Thank you for all your love, it has truly been insurmountable," Sanjana further wrote.

385.title: 8 killed, 20 injured as 2 double-decker buses collide on UP's Purvanchal Expressway
385.article_body: Eight people were killed while nearly 20 were injured after collision of two double-decker buses took place on Uttar Pradesh's Purvanchal expressway on Monday. Three people are critical and have been referred to Trauma Center in Lucknow for treatment, officials were quoted by reports as saying. CM Yogi Adityanath expressed grief over incident.

386.title: Was getting typecast, had romantic image on-screen: Ranbir on 'Shamshera'
386.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he was getting typecast in coming-of-age films. "I had this romantic image on-screen," he added. Speaking about 'Shamshera', Ranbir said, "This was a big deal for me because a lot of people don't offer me these kinds of roles." He stated it's his duty as an actor to try and get out of his comfort zone.

387.title: Boat carrying Haitian migrants sinks off Bahamas; 17 people dead
387.article_body: Security forces have recovered the bodies of 17 people and rescued 25 others after a boat carrying Haitian migrants capsized off the coast of the Bahamas, about 11 km from New Providence, on Sunday, according to the authorities. Bahamas PM Philip Brave Davis said that it's presumed that more people are missing. A multi-agency investigation has been launched, he added.

388.title: Maharashtra govt will fall due to its internal fights: Sanjay Raut
388.article_body: After Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil said it was decided with a "heavy heart" that Eknath Shinde would become the new CM of state, Shiv Sena’s Sanjay Raut said the Maharashtra government will fall due to its internal fights. "This dispensation will never stand on strong legs," Raut added. "This regime will not last," he stated.

389.title: President-elect Droupadi Murmu pays homage to Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat
389.article_body: Droupadi Murmu, who will take oath as India's 15th President today, paid homage to the 'father of the nation' Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat in the national capital. The ceremony of assumption of office will take place in Parliament's Central Hall. Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana will administer the oath of the office of the President to her.

390.title: Ghaziabad Police holds training programme for unemployed youths
390.article_body: Ghaziabad Police on Sunday initiated a training programme for imparting skills to unemployed youths. The programme titled 'Atmanirbhar training and awareness' aims to impart training to 150 selected persons in fire safety, veterinary care and training, security guards and medical care. Notably, the aim is to increase the employability of those youths who are less educated, an official said.

391.title: Iyer-Samson partnership made huge difference: Dhawan on 2nd WI ODI win
391.article_body: India captain Shikhar Dhawan praised Shreyas Iyer and Sanju Samson for their partnership during India's chase of 312 runs in the second ODI against West Indies. "We knew we could do it. We started a little slow. The Iyer-Samson partnership made a huge difference," stated Dhawan. India were 79/3 when Iyer and Samson added 99 runs for the fourth wicket.

392.title: J&K admin forcing people to participate in 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign: Mufti
392.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti raised questions over the collection of money by the Jammu and Kashmir administration for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign alleging that traders and shop owners are forced to deposit money for tricolours. The manner in which people are being forced looks like Kashmir is an "enemy territory" that needs to be captured, she said in a tweet.

393.title: Policybazaar reports IT systems breach, says 'No significant customer data exposed'
393.article_body: Insurance aggregator Policybazaar said that its IT systems were subject to illegal and unauthorised access, however, "no significant" customer data was exposed. In a regulatory filing to the exchanges, the company said that the unauthorised access was reported on July 19 and that it has also fixed the vulnerabilities identified in its IT systems.

394.title: Myanmar junta executes 4 democracy activists in first such killings in decades
394.article_body: Myanmar's military authorities have executed four democracy activists accused of helping carry out "terror acts", state media said on Monday, the nation's first executions in decades. Those executed included democracy figure Kyaw Min Yu, better known as Jimmy, former lawmaker from Aung San Suu Kyi's party and hip-hop artist Phyo Zeya Thaw, Hla Myo Aung and Aung Thura Zaw.

395.title: 2 killed, 5 injured after shooting at a public park in Los Angeles
395.article_body: At least two people were killed and five others were injured after one or more people opened fire at a public park in Los Angeles on Sunday afternoon. The shooting occurred at a car show in Peck Park in San Pedro. A spokesperson for Los Angeles Police said that they neither had a suspect in custody, nor a suspect description.

396.title: ED car carrying Bengal minister Partha’s close aide Arpita meets with accident
396.article_body: A car that was part of Enforcement Directorate's convoy ferrying West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's close aide Arpita Mukherjee to the CGO complex in Salt Lake met with accident on Sunday. News agency ANI shared pictures of incident, which show car damaged on one side. Mukherjee had been remanded to one-day ED custody in connection with the SSC scam case.

397.title: GHMC to now set up Annapurna '₹5/meal' canteens with seating facility
397.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has identified 32 locations in Hyderabad to set up 'Annapurna' canteens, which provide meals at a cost of ₹5, with seating arrangements for customers. The scheme provides a full spread of 400 grams of rice, 120 grams of sambar, 100 grams of vegetable curry and 15 grams of pickle to people.

398.title: Last few seats left for IIM-I & Jigsaw’s online Management & AI program
398.article_body: IIM Indore and Jigsaw announced that seats are filling up fast for their online Management & AI program which covers topics like Business Strategy, Building AI teams, Managerial Economics, ML, Deep Learning, Machine Vision, Conversational AI, etc. The 15-month program is ideal for aspirants with 3+ years of experience & a desire to be an AI-empowered leader, said Jigsaw.

399.title: India break Pak's world record for winning most consecutive ODI series against a team
399.article_body: India have broken the world record for winning most consecutive bilateral ODI series against a team. With their win in the second ODI against West Indies, India registered their 12th consecutive ODI series victory against West Indies. India overtook Pakistan, who held the previous world record with 11 consecutive ODI series victories against Zimbabwe.

400.title: Bar owner, employees assault 8 police personnel in Delhi's Hauz Khas, 10 held
400.article_body: Police have arrested 10 people after eight police personnel were allegedly assaulted by a bar owner and his employees during a raid in Delhi's Hauz Khas area. "We have started conducting a drive to clean up the area. There are many illegal bars and restaurants here, which attract a rowdy crowd," Deputy Commissioner of Police (Southwest), Manoj C, said.

401.title: Family quarantined, case complicated: Official on Delhi's monkeypox case
401.article_body: After Delhi's first case of monkeypox was detected, a health official said that the case is complicated as the patient has no history of foreign travel. "The patient's immediate family has been quarantined and their symptoms are being traced," the health official said. Another official said that they have been on alert since April.

402.title: Character assassination reached new level: Musk on report of dating Brin's wife
402.article_body: Responding to a report about his alleged affair with Google Co-founder Sergey Brin's wife Nicole Shanahan, the world's richest person Elon Musk said that "character assassination attacks have reached a new level this year". While Musk denied the alleged affair, he added, "I work crazy hours, so there just isn’t much time for shenanigans."

403.title: Mehmood shared incident where people threw his autograph away: Dharmendra
403.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra shared a picture of late actor Mehmood on his Instagram and recalled an incident where people came to Mehmood for his autograph at the beginning of his career. "Mehmood said...'I signed it with my name. They began looking at me in a weird way and told me...they wanted Prem Nath's autograph. They threw away mine'," Dharmendra stated.
